title: 110_s3133
content: The Act, known as the "Responsible Ownership of Public Land Act," defines terms like "covered lease," "fee," "Fund," and "Secretary." It establishes a production incentive fee and an Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy Fund. The Act establishes an annual production incentive fee for Federal onshore and offshore land under covered leases. The fee applies to leases in effect after final regulations are issued, with varying amounts per acre based on production duration. The Act establishes an annual production incentive fee for Federal onshore and offshore land under covered leases, with varying amounts per acre based on production duration. The fee is $50 per acre for the fifth year of the covered lease and each subsequent year. The Secretary is responsible for assessing and collecting the fee, and may issue regulations to prevent fee evasion. SEC. 4. ENERGY EFFICIENCY AND RENEWABLE ENERGY FUND. Establishment of the "Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy Fund" in the Treasury of the United States, funded by appropriations and fees collected under section 3. $100,000,000 allocated annually for solar energy technology research, development, and deployment. $65,000,000 allocated for next-generation wind turbines development, $200,000,000 for weatherization of low-income housing, and $70,000,000 for research and deployment of new technologies. The text chunk discusses the allocation of funds for research, development, and deployment of new technologies to improve energy efficiency and reduce greenhouse gas emissions from buildings. Additionally, $30,000,000 is designated for basic research on energy storage systems to support electric drive vehicles and electricity transmission. $30,000,000 allocated for research on energy storage systems for electric drive vehicles, stationary applications, and electricity transmission. $20,000,000 for energy storage systems demonstrations and $20,000,000 for vehicle energy storage systems demonstrations. $40,000,000 for necessary purposes. $40,000,000 allocated for research, development, and demonstration of advanced technologies to improve energy efficiency and environmental performance of vehicles. $50,000,000 for audits, investigations, and environmental mitigation for oil and gas production. Remainder for low-income home energy assistance program.
